EXECUTIVE CHEF       Summary    To obtain a challenging position where experience as an Executive
          Chef and a food handlers license will be utilized. And experience
          working for multiple James Beard Award winners Alfred Portale and
          Paul Bartolotta.
Core Qualifications
          Executive Chef          Menu Developing
          Chef de Cuisine          Schedule,Food &Labor
          Executive Sous Chef         Inventory &Ordering
          Sous Chef          Microsoft Excel &Word        Experience     08/2016   to   02/2017     Executive Chef    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Developed brunch, lunch, dinner and event menus
          Supervised, coordinated and participated in cooking activities and
          prep
          Instructed cooking personnel in fine points of following recipes
          Structured and maintained accurate payroll, scheduling, food
          costing, inventory and ordering.         09/2015   to   08/2016     Executive Chef    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Developed brunch, dinner and event menus
          Supervised, coordinated and participated in cooking activities and

Education and Training          High School Diploma  :   Liberal Arts    Gibraltar High School   －     State  ,   USA    math, reading, science, art and social science Liberal Arts            Loyola University of Chicago   －   City  ,   State  ,   USA    Art, civilization and language
          Alliance Francaise  Paris, France        Skills    Art, cooking, costing, inventory, math, payroll, personnel, reading, scheduling, Structured
story:
Let me turn this into a story about this chef's career journey:

In the bustling world of fine dining, there stands a culinary professional whose journey began with a diverse educational background, blending a high school diploma from Gibraltar High School with studies at Loyola University of Chicago, and even time spent at Alliance Francaise in Paris, France. This unique combination of liberal arts, language, and cultural exposure would later inform their distinctive approach to cuisine.

Their culinary journey took flight as a head line cook from 2013 to 2015, where they mastered the fundamentals of meat preparation, from carving to grinding, while maintaining the highest standards of kitchen cleanliness and safety. This foundation would prove invaluable in their ascent through the culinary ranks.

The next chapter saw them step into their first Executive Chef role in 2015, where they began crafting sophisticated brunch and dinner menus while leading kitchen teams with precision and care. Their management skills flourished as they balanced the complex demands of payroll, scheduling, and inventory management.

By 2016, they had further refined their expertise, expanding their repertoire to include lunch service alongside brunch and dinner offerings. Throughout their career, they've had the privilege of working alongside culinary giants, including James Beard Award winners Alfred Portale and Paul Bartolotta, whose influence helped shape their culinary philosophy.

Today, they stand as a well-rounded Executive Chef, equally comfortable developing innovative menus as they are managing the business aspects of kitchen operations. Their tool kit includes not just culinary expertise but also practical skills in Microsoft Excel and Word, making them a modern chef who bridges the gap between culinary artistry and business acumen.

Their story is one of continuous growth, from hands-on cooking to executive leadership, always maintaining the high standards that define fine dining excellence.
